name: VOA Recovery - Freedom House Manchester
description: Residential substance abuse treatment program for pregnant and parenting women operated by Volunteers of America Mid-States. They allow all children under 18 to stay with mothers during treatment, providing comprehensive family-centered care. Services include individual and group therapy, parenting classes, life skills training, medication-assisted treatment (Suboxone/Vivitrol), and case management. They have a 96% success rate for Manchester clients seeing increased visitations or reunification with children. The program addresses trauma and underlying issues to increase long-term sobriety success.
source: Verified from official website and cross-referenced with multiple sources
